section.name: Semantic Web Technologies
section.p: This section provides an overview of semantic web domain. In fact it reports all relevant information regarding W3C specification and main technologies which can be used to satisfy requirements.

subsection.name: W3C specification

tr.td: Resource Description Framework. Basic language which is possible to state a set of information about some resources with.
Language, based on RDF, which can model a relationships between classes, and properties: extension, domain and range.

Web Ontology Language. A powerful language which extends RDFSchema providing more expressive power. The full specification is not decidable in general, that's why a number of profiles or subsets, that give up some expressive power in exchange for more attractive and feasible computational characteristics, has been defined.

SPARQL is the standard query language over a RDF Store, meant to retrieve data according to specific requests without modifications. In order to provide write features SPARQL Update has been defined. Its syntax and principles recalls SQL.

subsection.p: All information reported in this subsection has been taken from:

ul.li: W3C specification (see http://www.w3.org/TR/rdf-primer/ and related documents)
Semantic Web Programming - J. Hebler, M. Fisher, R. Blace, A. Perez-Lopez - Wiley Publishing Inc.

p.strong: N.B.: A new SPARQL working draft has been submitted (v. 1.1). After February, 6 2012 this version may become the recommended one!

tr.td: Jena is a Java framework for building Semantic Web applications, which provides a collection of tools and Java libraries designed to help semantic web and linked-data apps development.
Pellet is an OWL 2 reasoner, so provides reasoning services for OWL ontologies for all ontology-based data management applications.
